title: Check the air quality in any location you want!

aqi.title: Air Quality Index
aqi.description: The Air Quality Index (AQI) is an indicator that measures air pollution by assessing its impact on human health based on concentrations of harmful substances such as PM2.5, PM10, nitrogen dioxide (NO2), and ozone (O3). AQI values are presented on a scale that informs about the level of risk, allowing users to make informed decisions regarding outdoor activities.

pm10.title: Particulate Matter PM10
pm10.about: PM10 is particles with a diameter of up to 10 micrometers that can enter the respiratory tract. They are generated by industrial activities, transportation, construction, and natural sources such as plant pollen and soil erosion.
pm10.healthEffectsText: PM10 can irritate the airways, exacerbate asthma, allergies, and increase the risk of lung infections. It is particularly dangerous for children, the elderly, and people with respiratory diseases.
pm10.occurrenceText: PM10 is commonly found in cities with heavy traffic, near construction sites and industries, and in dry areas where natural dust sources are more active.

pm2_5.title: Particulate Matter PM2.5
pm2_5.about: PM2.5 is fine particles with a diameter smaller than 2.5 micrometers, mainly generated by the burning of fuels in transportation, heating, and industry. Due to their small size, they can penetrate deep into the lungs and bloodstream, posing a serious health threat.
pm2_5.healthEffectsText: PM2.5 can lead to heart diseases, lung diseases, and cancer. Long-term exposure, especially among children, the elderly, and the sick, increases the risk of premature death.
pm2_5.occurrenceText: PM2.5 is mainly found in cities with heavy traffic and industrial areas, as well as during the heating season when emissions from stoves and transport are highest.

no2.title: Nitrogen Dioxide (NO2)
no2.about: NO2 is a gas primarily produced from the burning of fossil fuels in vehicles, power plants, and industry. It is one of the main components of smog and can also form in the atmosphere through chemical reactions.
no2.healthEffectsText: Nitrogen dioxide can irritate the airways, worsen asthma, lung diseases, and increase the risk of respiratory infections. Long-term exposure to NO2 is associated with serious health problems, especially in children and the elderly.
no2.occurrenceText: NO2 is mainly found in cities, particularly near roads with heavy traffic and in industrial areas where fossil fuels are burned.

o3.title: Ozone (O3)
o3.about: Ozone (O3) is a gas that naturally occurs in the atmosphere, but in polluted conditions, it forms through chemical reactions between pollutants such as nitrogen oxides and volatile organic compounds.
o3.healthEffectsText: Ozone can irritate the airways, cause coughing, breathing difficulties, and exacerbate asthma symptoms. Long-term exposure to ozone increases the risk of chronic lung diseases.
o3.occurrenceText: Ozone is mainly found in cities with high air pollution, especially during the summer when intense sunlight promotes its formation from other pollutants.

so2.title: Sulfur Dioxide (SO2)
so2.about: SO2 is a gas mainly produced during the burning of coal, petroleum, and other fossil fuels, as well as from industrial activities, particularly in refineries and smelting plants.
so2.healthEffectsText: Sulfur dioxide can irritate the airways, lead to coughing, shortness of breath, and exacerbate asthma symptoms. Long-term exposure to SO2 increases the risk of lung and heart diseases.
so2.occurrenceText: SO2 is mainly found in industrial areas, near coal power plants and refineries, and in cities where fossil fuels are burned.

co.title: Carbon Monoxide (CO)
co.about: CO is an odorless, colorless gas produced during the incomplete combustion of fossil fuels such as coal, gas, petroleum, and fuels used in cars.
co.healthEffectsText: Carbon monoxide limits the blood’s ability to transport oxygen, which can lead to dizziness, weakness, and, at high concentrations, death. People with heart conditions, children, and the elderly are particularly at risk.
co.occurrenceText: CO is mainly found in areas with heavy traffic, near exhaust sources such as cars, and in places where fuels are burned in stoves and boilers.

data.clearDataConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete all data?
data.clearDataWarning: This action will delete all user data and reset app settings. It cannot be undone.

info.technologyDetails: The app uses React Native for its user interface. With the i18next library, the app supports multiple languages, enhancing its accessibility on the global market. AsyncStorage ensures secure and efficient local data storage, allowing users to access personalized settings.
info.descriptionText: Created for the Hack Heroes 2024 contest, this advanced app allows users to monitor air quality worldwide. Users can check pollution levels and environmental conditions in any location, no matter where they are. The app supports multiple languages, making it accessible to users from diverse countries and cultures.
info.secondDescriptionText: Designed with safety and timeliness in mind, the app regularly retrieves data from reliable sources to provide the most accurate information. It also ensures a high standard of user privacy protection. This is a perfect tool for health- and environment-conscious individuals who want to stay aware of the air quality around them and in other regions worldwide.
